intro: Bolax bovei, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Bolax bovei has small, round, green pods that contain seeds, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
